CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1952, pg. 22 reads: " "Big Break Of 1953" Winners - With W.C.Handy, famous composer of the "St. Louis Blues," as guest of honor, and Earsley Kincaid and Catherine Maddox as producers, the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League announced the winners of their "Big Break of 1953" contest at Schenley High School last Friday night. The show announced prizes in several classifications...Second place winners are shown in photo on the right.  Carol Ann Duffy, left, tied for second-place honors in the popular classification with Morgan Thomas, rear row, far right.  Other second-place winners are Gloria Sciulli, blues; Betty Beatty, light classics, and in the rear row on the left, Walter Cobb, religious.- Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of second place prize winners in the "Big Break Of 1953" music contest, from left, first row: Carol Ann Duffy, Gloria Sciulli, and Betty Beatty; second row: Walter Cobb and Morgan Thomas, posed against curtain in Schenley High School
